name: Gardner
message: Hey, kid. In this weather, no one's gonna come all the way out just to eat, right? This isn't the only open table, is it? Why don't you move somewhere else?
Gardner is talking to the tall, sturdy man sitting next to the table. But the vibe doesn't feel very friendly-in fact, it seems kinda hostile.
Tonight, the only ones staying at the Fish Scale Inn are me, Gardner, and a guy named Thomas. So this must be Thomas.

name: Thomas
message: Don't be so uptight. Eating all alone in silence isn't any good, is it? I just want to enjoy my meal, that's all.

name: Gardner
message: Well, for me, eating at the same table as you won't make my meal taste any better, that's for sure.

name: Thomas
message: Hmph, you're a grumpy old man, aren't you.
With that attitude, no wonder you're an outcast in the academic society. Though, to be fair, ethnology's probably on the decline from here on out anyway！

name: Thomas
message: From now on it's the age of science. Ever since the Industrial Revolution, it's science that's keeping the world turning.

name: Gardner
message: And what the hell would you know about that, huh？
You're probably just parroting whatever some idiot around here told you.
It looks like I should step in before things get any more tense.
Mediating a fight as soon as I arrive in Arkham, huh......
The room with the fireplace burning is warm, and when I'm surrounded by these sturdy walls, even the sound of the wind raging outside feels like a hollow fabrication.
Maybe it's just the fatigue from the long journey, but even though I'm hungry, just sitting here makes me start to nod off.
The room isn't exactly spacious, but it's kind of lonely to have only three of us in a dining hall that could fit twenty people.
I bet Mrs. Hudson doesn't find much motivation just making meals for us, either.
Gardner clearly isn't happy that Thomas is coming along too.
But, just like Thomas said, if the ruins become famous, Gardner is sure to benefit from that at least a little.
Even as a scholar, it seems he's not entirely without desires.
I always thought university professors were the cold, logical type who never get flustered by anything, but that description definitely doesn't fit Gardner.
Gardner isn't pleased about having Thomas sitting next to him.
He keeps a permanent scowl and pokes intently at the food on the table.
Sure, Thomas seems like a shameless and self-centered guy, but there's no reason to hate him this much. Did something happen between the two?
When the topic of the ruins came up, Thomas's attitude seemed to change completely.

According to Gardner, this guy is barely a step away from being a conman, but he's apparently valuable to scholars. So why would someone like him be interested in some old ruins that probably aren't even profitable？
Every time my gaze drifts to the ring, Thomas starts fidgeting nervously. There's gotta be a story behind it.
He really looks like a shady dude. Mrs. Hudson says he's a businessman with farms and factories, but to me he just looks like a scam artist.
Is this just proof that you can't judge a book by its cover, or is there something tasty about Arkham for him...?
Maybe it's related to the talk about money the old stationmaster mentioned.
Anyway, it seems like it'd be best not to trust this guy.
Thomas seems to be quite the big eater, just like he looks. He's tackling the fish on his plate with hands that can't really be called elegant.

Does this guy not care at all about the grumpiness of Gardner sitting next to him? He doesn't bother turning his way or trying to start a conversation. Looks like that tense mood from earlier didn't faze him one bit.
Where the gem should be set in the ring, there's some sort of design engraved. It's small and worn down, so I can't really tell what it is......
Seems like it's modeled after some kind of tool or something.
Have I seen something like this before somewhere？
A pretty chunky ring is shining on the ring finger of Thomas's left hand.
From the looks of it, there's no rare metals or fancy gems on it at all. In other words, it's not really an expensive piece.

For someone like him-the kind you'd imagine wants to show off his status and current financial situation to others-to wear such a worthless piece of jewelry, there must be some kind of serious reason behind it.
When Thomas noticed that I had quickly spotted his ring, he curled his fingers to hide it. When I subtly glanced over at Gardner, he nodded knowingly.
Gardner knows something about the ring. And I feel like part of the reason he dislikes Thomas is hidden in that ring.

name: Gardner
message: Well, not bad, wouldn't you say？
I put a half-cooled piece of fish in my mouth. Gardner and Thomas had pretty much finished their meals already.

name: Gardner
message: I think I'll be heading out soon. They don't serve anything stronger than wine at this inn, so I can't have a proper after-dinner drink.

name: Thomas
message: Alright, guess I'll head back to my room too. Oh yeah, my room's right across from yours, so come by anytime if you need me.
See ya, Jonathan.
Gardner and Thomas each went back to their rooms.
Even though I wasn't finished eating yet. Can't really call either of them well-mannered guests.
Still, the atmosphere's getting tense.
Who knows what'll happen tomorrow...

name: Gardner
message: Hey, is there something wrong with that fish？

Gardner looks suspiciously at me for not making any move to touch my food. From my perspective, I was just trying not to focus on eating in the middle of his story. University professors really are such thoughtless types.

name: Gardner
message: It doesn't look great, but it doesn't taste bad. I've totally become hooked on the food here. If you're not going to eat, pass that plate over to me.

name: Jonathan
message: No, I'll eat... Thanks for being so thoughtful.
It's been steaming deliciously right in front of me for a while now.
It's been over 12 hours since I had a light meal before getting on the train this morning. I'm starving.
But before I start eating, I need to ask about the ruins of Arkham that I heard about in the room earlier.
It looks pretty well-cooked. Apparently, Mrs. Hudson is really exceptional at cooking.
I wonder if the fish was caught in the coastal waters near Arkham. It seems to be a kind I've never seen before.

name: Gardner
message: Jonathan, you're not actually believing what a typical ignorant fellow like that is saying, are you？

name: Gardner
message: Like I said earlier, right now we have absolutely no clue what era or what kind of culture the people who left this stuff belonged to.
If we could figure that out, the academic world would go nuts.

name: Thomas
message: Ruins? What are you talking about? Is there something like that here?

name: Gardner
message: Think about it carefully. If it turns out this stuff belonged to the native peoples...

name: Thomas
message: Native peoples？ Like, Indians or something？

name: Gardner
message: You'll be shocked when you see it yourself. To find traces of megalithic civilization here in England！ It's a massive discovery.

name: Thomas
message: What are you talking about？

name: Gardner
message: You just keep quiet！
I'm telling you now, it's not worth any money. You can't really put a price on that thing. If you're looking for treasure hunting, you'd be better off going to Egypt or something.

name: Jonathan
message: What exactly have you found there？

name: Gardner
message: Several structures, murals that suggest idol worship, and some undeciphered written characters. Looks like they had an advanced culture with their own language.

name: Gardner
message: If it were the Incas or Aztecs, that'd be one thing, but finding this on Great Britain is a big deal.

name: Jonathan
message: When you say 'megalithic civilization'...

name: Gardner
message: You probably wouldn’t understand if I started talking academically. To put it simply, it's a general term for ruins built with stone structures that show off advanced architectural techniques-stuff that would’ve been totally impossible with the technology back then.

name: Thomas
message: Sounds like an interesting story... Maybe I’ll check it out too.

name: Gardner
message: What do you say, Jonathan? Want to go check it out tomorrow? If that gets turned into an article, I bet it'll stir up quite the commotion.

name: Jonathan
message: If the Professor would show us around, I’d be glad to.

name: Gardner
message: Of course. I’d be happy to guide you.

name: Thomas
message: I’m coming along too.

name: Gardner
message: Why the hell are you coming?！
I'm saying I'm going to show Jonathan around.

name: Thomas
message: What's the problem? Having one more person isn’t gonna make a big difference, right?

name: Gardner
message: I don’t know what your motives are, but believe me, there’s pretty much no chance you’ll get anything out of it.

name: Thomas
message: I've been listening, and you’ve been calling me a grave robber and whatever you want. Isn’t your real goal just to have Jonathan write an article about the ruins anyway?

name: Gardner
message: ...What was that？

name: Thomas
message: Now that the ruins are getting attention, the academic community can't just ignore it, you know. You get to make a name for yourself as the discoverer, and you can also score some funding.

name: Gardner
message: I'm a scholar. I'm not doing this for the money！

name: Thomas
message: Well... who really knows what the truth is.
Aren't you and I pretty much the same in the end？

name: Jonathan
message: Does it really matter either way? There's no point in arguing in a place like this. Let's all just go together tomorrow.

name: Gardner
message: Still, it's strange. For a rundown inn like this to have three guests in one night. I've been staying here for a whole week, and this is the first time this has happened.

name: Jonathan
message: A whole week？ That means those ruins must be quite the valuable research material.

name: Gardner
message: Exactly. They have great academic significance.

name: Thomas
message: I was just getting bored, anyway. Sometimes sightseeing at ruins sounds like a good idea. Who knows, maybe we'll even find some old gold coins or something.

name: Thomas
message: But this weather's a real pain. If it's like this just when I arrived, who knows what it'll be like going forward.

name: Jonathan
message: So, why did you come to Arkham？
Is there really a way to make money in a place like this?

name: Thomas
message: Nah... It's just a vacation.

name: Gardner
message: A vacation in a chilly fishing village like this, huh...

name: Jonathan
message: I asked a station attendant in Salem, and he said they used to find gold in Arkham. He said it was when he was a boy, so that was probably fifty years ago or something.
The only reason I can think of for this guy to visit such a totally out-of-place village is that. I don't know where he heard about the gold, but that must be what he's after.

name: Gardner
message: I can't believe there's a gold vein running through a place like this. I've never even seen any signs of it.
After saying that, Gardner glanced sideways at Thomas.
Looks like, just like me, he's suspecting this guy's after gold and the rights that come with it.

name: Thomas
message: ......So what about you, then? What'd you come here for?
You look like some rich boy, but what business could you possibly have in a place like this?

name: Gardner
message: This guy Jonathan's a magazine reporter. Not some shady character like you.

name: Thomas
message: You telling me there's a scoop lying around in this village？

name: Thomas
message: Oh right, I haven't introduced myself yet. I'm Thomas Paine.　　　　　　You came from London too, right? So did I.

name: Jonathan
message: Jonathan Swift.

name: Thomas
message: London's a great city. Still, because of work I'm flying all over　　　　　　the place, so there are months I barely get to spend any days back　　　　　　at my own flat.

name: Gardner
message: Hmph, a fool revealing his own true colors. Real rich people don't　　　　　　　　set themselves up with a room in London. They usually live in a　　　　　　　　house out in the suburbs, only coming into the city when they　　　　　　　　need to.

name: Thomas
message: What was that‥‥‥‥? You trying to diss the way I live?
Where I live is none of your business.

name: Gardner
message: I'm just speaking in general. It's just that your attitude is so　　　　　　　　ridiculous, I just wanted to give you some advice.

name: Thomas
message: What do you mean by that?！

name: Gardner
message: You come off just like some scammer desperate to worm his way　　　　　　　　into high society.
And here we go again, the mood’s getting tense‥‥‥
These two really just don't get along.
